content.question: The graph of one cycle of the displacement <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> as a function of time <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mi>t</mi></mstyle></math> for a particle in simple harmoic motion is shown. Which of the following is the corresponding graph for velocity <math alttext="v" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> as a function of time <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for the particle?

choices.label: The figure presents a graph with a horizontal axis labeled t, a vertical axis labeled v, and the intersection of the horizontal and vertical axis labeled 0 comma 0. The line begins on the vertical axis, below the horizontal axis, at a minimum velocity. The line moves upward and to the right, crossing the horizontal axis after a time interval of t. The line continues to move upward and to the right, reaches a maximum velocity after the same time interval, then curves back downward, moving downward and to the right. The line crosses the horizontal axis after the same time interval and continues moving downward and to the right, ending at the minimum velocity after the same time interval.

The figure present a graph with a horizontal axis labeled t, a vertical axis labeled v, and the intersection of the horizontal and the vertical axis labeled 0 comma 0.  The line begins at the point 0 comma 0  axis and moves upward and to the right reaching a maximum velocity after a time interval of t. The line then curves downward, moving downward and to the right. The line crosses the horizontal axis after the same time interval and continues moving downward and to the right to a minimum velocity after the same time interval. The line then curves upward and moves upward and to the right ending on the horizontal axis after the same time interval.

The figure presents a graph with a horizontal axis labeled t, a vertical axis labeled v, and the intersection of the horizontal and vertical axis labeled 0 comma 0. The line begins at the point 0 comma 0 and moves downward and to the right reaching a minimum velocity after a time interval of t. The line then curves upward moving upward and to the right. The line crosses the horizontal axis after the same time interval and continues moving upward and to the right and reaches a maximum velocity after the same time interval. The line then curves downward and moves down and to the right ending on the horizontal axis after the same time interval.

The figure present a graph with a horizontal axis labeled t, a vertical axis labeled v and the intersection of the horizontal and vertical axis labeled 0 comma 0. The line begins at the point 0 comma 0 and moves upward and to the right reaching a maximum velocity after a time interval of t. The line then curves downward, moving downward and to the right. The line reaches the horizontal axis after the same time interval and then turns and moves upward and to the right and reaches the same maximum velocity after the same time interval. The line then curves downward, moving downward and to the right ending on the horizontal axis after the same time interval.

The figure presents a graph with a horizontal axis labeled t, a vertical axis labeled v, and the intersection of the horizontal axis and vertical axis labeled 0 comma 0. The line begins on the vertical axis at a maximum velocity and moves downward and to the right reaching the horizontal axis after a time interval of t. The line then turns and moves upward and to the right to the maximum velocity after the same time interval. The line then curves downward, moving downward and to the right, reaching the horizontal axis after the same time interval. The line then turns and moves upward and to the right reaching the maximum velocity after the same time interval.

content.answer: The figure presents a graph with a horizontal axis labeled t, a vertical axis labeled v, and the intersection of the horizontal and vertical axis labeled 0 comma 0. The line begins at the point 0 comma 0 and moves downward and to the right reaching a minimum velocity after a time interval of t. The line then curves upward moving upward and to the right. The line crosses the horizontal axis after the same time interval and continues moving upward and to the right and reaches a maximum velocity after the same time interval. The line then curves downward and moves down and to the right ending on the horizontal axis after the same time interval.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
